title: Inattentional Blindness: Invisible Gorillas
description: Learn Inattentional Blindness: Invisible Gorillas in one minute.

hook.text: Researchers told viewers to count passes. Half missed a gorilla walk through.

buildup.text: When attention is locked on a task, unexpected objects become invisible.

discovery.text: Simons and Chabris proved we literally don't see what we're not looking for.

twist.text: Expertise makes it worseâ€”doctors miss anomalies outside their search pattern.

climax.text: Awareness of this blind spot is the first step to designing around it.

punchline.text: You can't learn what you can't see.

quiz.question: What does inattentional blindness show?
options: Focused attention can make us miss obvious things
Gorillas are hard to see in dark rooms
